A: Rhabdoid tumor of kidney (RTK). AGGRESSIVE! Infants (median: ~1 yr). Discohesive; large cells w/eccentric large vesicular nuclei, big nucleoli; +LVI. IHC: -INI1; patchy +EMA/CK. Molec: hSNF5/INI1 inactivation on 22q11; germline a/w concurrent RTK & AT/RT. #UMichPath #PediPath pic.twitter.com/eNKoLgPd6U

Neuroblastoma is the most common "extracranial solid tumor of children." Differentiating subtype has >5% ganglionic-appearing neuroblasts, Schwannian stroma-poor but usually neuropil-rich, and usually low mitotic-karyorrhectic index. #pedipath pic.twitter.com/GNSHNNjCQS
Canning: Gonadoblastoma can occur as early as 5 months in patients with Turner Mosaic with Y chromosome material. Consider early gonadectomy for all abdominal #gonads. http://ow.ly/ZLOq30kIi7Q¬†

A: Goblet cell carcinoid tumor (aka adenocarcinoid). Histo: Infiltrative discrete clusters of bland goblet cells. Course: Good prognosis; need to differentiate from 'mixed carcinoid-adenoCA': Morph. is >50% carcinoma, often infiltrating into cecum w/ mets at Dx #UMichPath #GIPath pic.twitter.com/g2BJrO1uBo

Thyroid - 11 year old boy.Multiple densely hypercellular nodules, interespersed with normal thyroid.Some nodules show invasion, several with vascular space invasion.Many nodules show 'RAS-like' nuclear atypia.Yes - it's thyroid carcinoma arising in DICER1 syndrome. pic.twitter.com/3y3gQ1Q4Gl

A: Candidal esophagitis. PAS or GMS to confirm if u can‚Äôt see on H&E. Histo: Hint is neutrophils/microabscesses in superficial epi, PAS/GMS show pseudohyphae & budding spores in squamous debris. A/w immunocompromised, oral/inhaled corticosteroids. DDx: CMV/HSV. #UMichPath #GIPath pic.twitter.com/FTK4RC5Qht

Gastroblastoma is a rare biphasic neoplasm of the gastric muscularis propria (usually antrum) that harbors a MALAT1-GLI1 fusion.  It sometimes behaves aggressively.  The immunostain is a keratin cam 5.2, which stains only the epithelial component.  http://www.innovativepathologypress.com¬† pic.twitter.com/jYkHAjpLwT

Prostatic Duct Adenocarcinoma with papillary architecture& pseudostratified columnar epithelium,graded as GS4+4, generally more aggressive than conventional acinar prostatecancer, PIN cocktail(right image)with loss of basal cells& +AMACR #ProstateCancer @UMichPath #Pathologists pic.twitter.com/I70YBOfw19

Urothelial Papilloma-papillary neoplasm, minimal branching, lined by normal urothelium, prominent umbrella cells(here vacuolated),no significant cytologic atypia; in younger pts,benign course,rare recurrence(<10%);important not to overcall as #BladderCancer @UMichPath #Pathology pic.twitter.com/7G3Ez4dxkg

Vastitis nodosa- benign ductular proliferation in rxn to obstruction of vas deferens , typically post-vasectomy; spermatozoa in lumen, sperm granuloma, intraneural/perineural invasion occasionally (shown here)- do not overcall as carcinoma! #pathology #cancer @UMichPath pic.twitter.com/9kOH7vJLVF
